title: Masakazu Washida
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Washida was born in <a href="Fukui%20%28city%29">Fukui</a> on November 15, 1978. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">JEF United Ichihara</a> in 1997. However he could not play at all in the match until 1998. In 1999, he moved to newly was promoted to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club, <a href="Montedio%20Yamagata">Montedio Yamagata</a>. He played many matches as center back from 1999 and became a regular player from 2001. In 2004, he returned to JEF United Ichihara. However he could hardly play in the match. In 2005, he moved to J2 club <a href="Kyoto%20Sanga%20FC">Kyoto Purple Sanga</a>. Although the club won the champions in 2005 and was promoted to J1 from 2006, he could not play many matches in both seasons. In 2007, he moved to J2 club Montedio Yamagata again and played many matches. In 2008, he moved to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> (JFL) club <a href="Tochigi%20SC">Tochigi SC</a>. He played as regular player and the club was promoted to J2 end of 2008 season. However he moved to JFL club <a href="FC%20Ryukyu">FC Ryukyu</a> in 2009. Although he played many matches in 2009, he could not play at all in the match in 2010. In June 2010, he moved to <a href="Japanese%20Prefectural%20Leagues">Prefectural Leagues</a> club <a href="SC%20Sagamihara">SC Sagamihara</a>. He retired end of 2010 season.
